items.title: YouTube Shorts launches AI stickers, new video tools
items.summary:
- YouTube Shorts introduces new features for video creation, including a video editor and AI-generated stickers.
- Enhanced video editor allows adjustment of clip timing, rearranging clips, adding music, and previewing videos.
- New AI stickers let users create custom stickers from text prompts, and beat-syncing aligns clips with music.
- Updates expected to attract creators amid potential TikTok ban in the US on April 5, 2025.

items.title: Dollar falls as tariffs raise concerns over global growth
items.summary:
- The US dollar reached six-month lows against the euro, yen, and Swiss franc after President Trump's announcement of new import tariffs.
- A 10% tariff on all US imports and higher rates for certain trading partners raised global growth concerns, leading to market declines.
- Investors are moving to safer assets like bonds and gold amidst the turmoil.
- The euro increased by 1.74% to US$1.1037, while the dollar decreased by 1.95% against the yen and 2.35% against the Swiss franc.
- Analysts warn that the tariffs may cause economic stagnation and inflation, with concerns over a crisis of confidence in the US dollar.

items.title: Uber, WeRide to launch self-driving vehicles in Dubai
items.summary:
- Uber partners with WeRide and Dubai's RTA to launch self-driving vehicles.
- Goal is to achieve 25% autonomous trips in Dubai by 2030.
- WeRide is the first autonomous partner for Uber in Dubai, focusing on pilot programs and safety.
- WeRide secured a national license for self-driving in July 2023, starting operations in Abu Dhabi in December 2024.
- Details on the Dubai pilot's timeline and rollout will be announced soon.

items.title: Microsoft delays Jakarta data center over AI oversupply risk
items.summary:
- Microsoft has delayed several data center projects globally, including in Jakarta, due to strategic flexibility concerns.
- Analysts suggest the delay is tied to risks of AI infrastructure oversupply.
- Work on one Jakarta site is paused, but the Indonesia Central cloud region is still scheduled to launch in Q2 2025.
- Microsoft allocated US$80 billion for data centers for the fiscal year ending June 2025 but will slow new spending to upgrade existing facilities.
- Adjustments are attributed to overestimated AI demand and supply chain challenges.

items.title: Aussie politicians turn to Chinese social media ahead of 2025 election
items.summary:
- Australian politicians are using Chinese social media platforms like Xiaohongshu to engage with Chinese-Australian communities before the federal election on May 3.
- Key electorates like Bennelong and Chisholm are seeing MPs such as Jerome Laxale actively reach out to these communities.
- Laxale has distributed 30,000 red envelopes with QR codes linking to his Xiaohongshu and WeChat accounts, stating the importance of communicating where the electorate is.
- The Liberal Party is also focusing on reconnecting with Chinese-Australian voters after a 6.6% decline in support during the 2022 election.

items.title: Intel stock rises 4% after report on TSMC joint venture
items.summary:
- Intel's stock increased by over 4% on April 3, after a report suggested a joint venture with TSMC.
- This rise occurred following a previous drop of more than 5% earlier that day.
- The report indicates a tentative agreement for a joint venture that may utilize Intel's manufacturing facilities.
- The joint venture would enable Intel and U.S. chipmakers to hold a majority stake.
- The collaboration was reportedly explored at the request of the Trump administration, according to Bloomberg News in February.
- Intel has yet to officially comment on the report.

items.title: Trump proposes TikTok sale for tariff relief deal
items.summary:
- US President Donald Trump suggested a deal involving TikTok and US tariffs on Chinese imports.
- TikTok faces an April 5 deadline to finalize a sale to a non-Chinese buyer to avoid a ban in the US.
- Trump stated that several investors have shown interest, and his administration is 'very close' to an agreement.
- This proposal comes after Trump's announcement of a 10% baseline tariff on all US imports, affecting Chinese goods with a 54% tariff.
- TikTok has not commented on the proposed deal.

items.title: Pizza chain Papa John’s expands AI in ordering with Google Cloud
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Papa John’s International is enhancing its customer ordering process by integrating AI via an expanded partnership with Google Cloud.
- New features will include personalized push notifications, marketing emails, loyalty program offers, an online chatbot, and voice-assisted ordering.
- Chief digital officer Kevin Vasconi highlighted scalability, security, and cost-efficiency as priorities for the AI integration.
- CEO Todd Penegor noted the company’s previous technological lag but is optimistic about AI advancements.
- Future plans include using AI for in-store operations, like optimizing delivery routes and managing inventory.
- Papa John’s was the first national pizza chain to offer online ordering to all U.S. customers in 2001.

items.title: AI drives Chinese Q&A platform Zhihu to its first profitability
items.summary:
- Zhihu has announced its first quarterly profitability since going public.
- The achievement is attributed to the integration of AI, particularly the new "Zhida" feature.
- Zhida automatically generates answers using content from verified experts, attracting over 10 million monthly active users.
- Zhihu has over 81 million monthly active users and is compared to platforms like Quora and LinkedIn.
- The platform aims to be a center for professional knowledge sharing following LinkedIn's exit from mainland China in 2023.
- Zhihu's AI-driven features strengthen its position in China's digital landscape by leveraging its professional and scholarly network.

items.title: Singapore tops startup growth as Asian cities rise: report
items.summary:
- Singapore has surpassed San Francisco in the concentration of fast-growing startups according to the 2025 Hypergrowth Startup Index by HubSpot for Startups.
- Asian cities like Shanghai and Beijing are emerging as prominent innovation hubs.
- Investors are prioritizing sustainable business models and strategic partnerships over rapid scaling.
- Monthly deal counts have decreased by 50% since 2021, while average deal sizes have risen by 43%, now at US$50 million in 2024.
- Mergers and acquisitions are the dominant exit strategy, making up 43% of recent exits, with IPOs only accounting for 6%.
- Traditional sectors such as energy are outperforming tech-driven industries, with energy growth at 37%, IT at 36%, and B2B at 35%.

items.title: ASML CEO warns geopolitics may hurt innovation under US tariffs
items.summary:
- ASML raises concerns about geopolitical tensions hindering industry innovation.
- CEO Christophe Fouquet points to export controls affecting collaboration but doesn't specify on new US tariffs.
- The US tariffs, imposed by President Trump, significantly impact imports from several countries, including the Netherlands, with an uncertain effect on chip manufacturing tools.
- ASML’s EUV lithography machines are critical for high-end electronics, with 16% of 2024 net sales from US facilities.
- Major clients like Intel, TSMC, and Samsung are expanding operations in the US due to incentives from the 2022 Chips and Science Act.
- The Netherlands faces a 24% duty under new tariffs, leading to potential EU retaliatory measures.

items.title: The Radical Fund, IFC back women-led climate tech startups
items.summary:
- The Radical Fund partners with the IFC to support women-led climate tech startups in Singapore.
- Women-led startups receive less than 2% of global venture capital according to Pitchbook 2023.
- Barriers in Southeast Asia limit women's roles in climate tech despite high potential.
- The We Fund Climate program offers funding, workshops, and strategies for gender inclusion.
- In November 2024, they co-hosted an event at the Dubai Global Women’s Forum to promote inclusive investment.
- The initiative aims for at least 30% of its climate tech portfolio to be women-led and 30% representation of women in leadership roles.
- Focus on early-stage investments in Southeast Asia addressing climate adaptation and mitigation.

items.title: Fintech firm Block expands its mobile platform into banking
items.author: Jack Dorsey, Owen Jennings
items.summary:
- Block Inc. is positioning Cash App as a banking option for US households.
- The app has 57 million active users; only 2.5 million deposit paychecks directly into Cash App.
- Cash App now offers high-yield savings accounts, debit cards, short-term lending, and buy now, pay later options.
- In March, Square Financial Services received FDIC approval for issuing short-term consumer loans.
- Block's stock has dropped 32% year-to-date, down 80% from its 2021 peak.
- The target market is households earning up to US$150,000 annually.
- The objective is to evolve from a payment app to a full-service banking platform.
- Block competes with Chime and Robinhood and has faced regulatory scrutiny including a CFPB order for refunds.

items.title: Musk’s $1t spending cuts worry tech investors
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Elon Musk announced $1 trillion in spending cuts affecting Tesla, SpaceX, and Twitter.
- Investors are concerned about the potential impact on innovation and growth in the tech sector.
- Musk's cost-cutting measures could lead to significant job losses and reduced operational capacities across companies he leads.

items.title: TikTok may face $553m fine over EU data transfer violations
items.summary:
- TikTok's parent company, ByteDance Ltd., may face a fine exceeding €500 million (US$553.08 million) for violating EU data protection laws.
- The issue arose from unauthorized transfer of European user data to China, accessed by engineers.
- The Data Protection Commission (DPC) found breaches of the EU's GDPR and may enforce a halt on these data transfers.
- A final decision is expected by the end of April, pending confirmation of the fine amount.
- If confirmed, this would rank as the third-largest GDPR fine to date, following fines against Meta and Amazon.
- The investigation was initiated in 2021 due to concerns over data access by Chinese-based engineers.
- In September 2023, TikTok was previously fined €345 million (US$381.62 million) for mishandling children’s data.

items.title: QED Investors lead $75m series B in fintech startup Felix Pago
items.summary:
- Felix Pago, a Miami-based remittance startup, raised US$75 million in a series B round led by QED Investors.
- Plans include expansion into Colombia, Ecuador, and Peru, alongside new credit products and savings accounts.
- Founded in 2020, Felix Pago processed over US$1 billion in transfers in 2024, serving multiple countries in Latin America.
- Aiming to challenge traditional remittance providers in the US$160 billion market, the company is also exploring acquisitions.
- Not disclosed its valuation but is nearing unicorn status, reporting a 20% monthly transaction volume increase with an average transfer of US$290.

items.title: Franklin Templeton leads fintech firm Plaid’s $575m fundraise
items.summary:
- Franklin Templeton leads a $575 million fundraising round for fintech firm Plaid.
- The investment highlights significant interest in fintech solutions.
- Plaid aims to expand its offerings and enhance its platform with the new capital.

items.title: Israeli AI company Unframe raises $30m series A
items.summary:
- Israeli AI company Unframe has successfully raised $30 million in a Series A funding round.
- The funding round was led by venture capital firms with a focus on technological innovation.
- Unframe plans to use the funds to enhance its AI-driven solutions and expand its market presence.

items.title: Bitcoin related startups see 50% surge in pre-seed funding
items.summary:
- Pre-seed funding for bitcoin-native startups rose by 50% in 2024, according to Trammell Venture Partners.
- From 2021 to 2024, pre-seed deals jumped by 767%, attracting nearly US$1.2 billion over four years.
- Bitcoin and ethereum's price increases and SEC approval of ETFs boosted investor interest, despite a 22% decline in total capital raised by bitcoin-native startups through series B in 2024.

items.title: General Atlantic leads $308m investment in US AI video company
items.summary:
- Runway, a New York-based video company, raised $308 million in a funding round led by General Atlantic.
- The company is reportedly valued at over $3 billion, although Runway did not confirm this.
- Participants included SoftBank Group, Nvidia, Fidelity Management & Research Company, and Baillie Gifford.
- The funds will enhance Runway’s AI research and aim at developing new media tools, including AI-driven film and animation studios.
- Runway provides software that creates videos from text prompts or images and recently partnered with Lionsgate on a video generation model.

items.title: Weekly funding: India-based firms take top 5 spots
items.author: Queena Wadyanti, Charmaine de Lazo
items.summary:
- Significant startup funding activities reported in Asia.
- Top 10 funding deals of the week collated.
- For detailed information, a data subscription is required.
- Links provided to track active investors and funding lists in the region.

items.title: US says tariffs target Indonesia’s unfair trade policies
items.summary:
- The US has imposed a 32% tariff on imports from Indonesia.
- This tariff aims to address trade imbalances and promote US manufacturing.
- The decision is influenced by Indonesia's economic policies, including a 30% import tariff on US ethanol compared to the US's 2.5% tariff.
- Concerns were raised about Indonesia's local content requirements as non-tariff trade barriers.
- Indonesia's import licensing regime and new foreign exchange regulations complicate trade further.
- Exporters must keep 100% of natural resource earnings in local banks for one year under Government Regulation No. 8/2025.

items.title: Russia and allies excluded from Trump’s new tariffs
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Trump announces new tariffs, excluding Russia and its allies.
- The decision reflects ongoing geopolitical tensions and trade considerations.
- Analysts suggest this move may impact international relations and trade flows.

items.title: China’s growth strategies can counter US tariffs, economists say
items.summary:
- Economists suggest that China can use various growth strategies to mitigate impacts from US tariffs.
- Emphasis on innovation and market diversification as key strategies.
- Increased focus on domestic consumption in China to drive economic growth.

items.title: Austrian minister proposes targeted response to US tariffs
Southeast Asia hit hard by Trump tariffs
items.summary:
- Southeast Asia experiences significant economic impact from tariffs imposed by the Trump administration.
- Countries in the region face challenges in exports as a result of the trade policies.
- Increased costs on goods and diminished production efficiency are reported across various industries.

items.title: Musk to leave DOGE in May
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Elon Musk set to step away from involvement with Dogecoin in May.
- This decision has sparked speculation within the cryptocurrency community.
- Potential implications for Dogecoin's market value and its future following Musk's departure.

items.title: Crypto markets slide after Trump tariff announcement
items.summary:
- Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies suffered significant losses on April 3 after US President Donald Trump announced new tariffs.
- Bitcoin fell 5% to $81,849.63; ether dropped 7% and solana dropped 13%.
- The S&P 500 was set for its worst day since September 2022, reflecting broader market declines.
- Shares of crypto-related companies like Coinbase and MicroStrategy fell over 7%.
- Trump's tariffs, starting at 10%, raised fears of a global trade war.
- Ben Kurland (CEO at DYOR) remarked that Bitcoin is influenced by global liquidity signals and rate expectations.
- Bitcoin has fluctuated between $80,000 and $90,000, mirroring equities closely.
- David Hernandez from 21Shares noted that Bitcoin's holding of key technical levels signals strong demand, despite the tariffs exceeding expectations, which might provide clarity for institutional investors.

items.title: Why regulators said yes to Grab’s Singapore taxi play
items.summary:
- Singapore's Land Transport Authority issued a street-hail service operator license to GrabCab, a subsidiary of Grab Holdings, valid for 10 years from April 9.
- Grab's entry into the taxi sector is seen as an effort to start a new fleet rather than acquire an existing one, potentially increasing competition.
- Grab plans to expand its fleet to at least 800 taxis within three years and will feature hybrid and electric vehicles.
- The license approval follows the failure of Grab's proposed acquisition of Trans-cab due to competition concerns from the CCCS.
- Observers note low barriers to entry in the taxi market, with potential for profitability despite market shrinkage.

items.title: Mapping SEA’s leading cleantech players
items.summary:
- Overview of key players in Southeast Asia’s cleantech sector.
- Highlights active backers and investment trends.
- For landscape reports, visit [here](https://www.techinasia.com/category/landscape-reports).
- For inaccuracies, contact research@techinasia.com.

items.title: Meituan reshuffles leadership as senior exec steps aside
items.summary:
- Senior VP Zhang Chuan to step down from day-to-day operations as of May and move to an advisory role.
- Announcement made by CEO Wang Xing on April 3, signaling a leadership shift.
- Zhang has been instrumental in scaling Meituan's key businesses since joining in 2017.
- Meituan is reorganizing its business units, merging the Dianping division into the Core Local Commerce unit.
- Former SaaS head Xiao Fei appointed to lead new software and hardware services unit.
- Restructuring aimed at streamlining operations and enhancing international growth efforts.

items.title: Chatbots don’t have to be a pain
items.summary:
- Businesses are investing heavily in AI chatbots, with banks expected to invest $18.4 billion by 2028.
- AI chatbots are effective with simple queries but struggle with complex context and nuances.
- Success requires seeing AI integration as part of a broader customer service strategy rather than focusing solely on cost savings.
- Chinese startup Zhipu AI has launched a competitive AI product, AutoGLM Rumination, claiming superiority over existing models like DeepSeek and GPT-4 in benchmarks.
- Customer frustration with chatbots can lead to abandonment if navigation is difficult or human support is hard to reach.

items.title: Israeli AI firm AutonomyAI nets $4m pre-seed funding
items.summary:
- Israeli AI startup AutonomyAI raises $4 million in pre-seed funding.
- Funding round led by several unnamed investors.
- AutonomyAI focuses on developing AI-driven solutions for various industries.

items.title: US House panel advances bill to regulate stablecoins
items.summary:
- A bipartisan bill to regulate privately issued stablecoins has been advanced by a US House committee.
- Stablecoins must be backed 1:1 by US dollars or equivalent assets.
- The bill aims to protect consumers and support industry growth.
- Proposed amendments to ban Trump and tech firms from issuing tokens and prevent taxpayer-funded bailouts were not adopted.
- Visa, PayPal, and Stripe have invested in stablecoin projects, indicating the sector's profitability.

items.title: Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article lists the 50 Indonesian startups and tech companies that have raised the most funding from investors in the past two years.
- It aims to identify firms with potential global impact based on funding data.
- For more information, readers can access Tech in Asia’s database of tech companies or their research methodology.

items.title: Oracle reports second security breach in a month
items.summary:
- Oracle has reported a security breach involving stolen legacy client login credentials, its second incident in a month.
- The breach affected an inactive system from eight years ago, compromising usernames, passkeys, and encrypted passwords.
- Oracle claims the stolen credentials pose minimal risk and are unrelated to a prior attack targeting its health-care clients.
- An extortion attempt was made by the attacker, but further details have not been disclosed by Oracle.

items.title: Indian travel fintech firm Scapia bags $40m series B
items.summary:
- Scapia raised US$40 million in a series B funding round.
- Investment led by Peak XV Partners, with participation from Elevation Capital, Z47, and 3STATE Capital.
- Funds are aimed at expanding the team, improving products, and enhancing AI capabilities in India’s travel and financial services market.
- Scapia offers a co-branded credit card with Federal Bank featuring no joining or annual fees, no forex markup, and additional perks like lounge access and cashback.

items.title: YouTube partners with Shopee to launch shopping affiliate in SG
items.summary:
- YouTube has launched a shopping affiliate program in Singapore in partnership with Shopee.
- Creators can tag products in videos and live streams for seamless purchases via Shopee.
- This program provides new monetization options for creators and a larger audience for Shopee sellers.
- Video commerce is projected to account for 20% of Southeast Asian ecommerce GMV in 2024.
- 62% of Singaporean consumers have purchased products discovered on YouTube.
- The program has previously succeeded in Indonesia, Vietnam, Malaysia, and Thailand, with Shopee Indonesia reporting a sixfold increase in daily orders.

items.title: SG-based Wild Ventures launches, concludes $746k angel round
items.author: Bjorn Bergstrom, Arvid Lithander, Shannon Cullum, Malin Renstrom
items.summary:
- Singapore-based The Wild Ventures concluded an oversubscribed SG$1 million (around US$746,000) angel funding round on April 3.
- The early-stage venture fund focuses on AI-powered brands and has developed three brands: Wild Palace, Poositive Pets, and Future Paper.
- The firm invests in external brands that align with its sustainability and innovation goals.

items.title: Trump’s tariff escalation triggers 4% US selloff
items.summary:
- Donald Trump’s new tariffs led to a 4% drop in US equity index futures.
- The US dollar weakened significantly, with a 1.5% decline against the Japanese yen and over 1% against the euro.
- In comparison, Asian stocks declined by 1.7%, and European futures dropped 2.4% before partially recovering.
- The tariffs heightened trade tensions and raised concerns regarding economic damage.

items.title: Malaysia says it won’t retaliate against Trump’s tariffs
items.summary:
- Malaysia's Ministry of Investment, Trade, and Industry will not impose retaliatory tariffs against the US.
- Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim chairs the National Geoeconomic Command Centre to assess the economic impact of the 10% US tariff hikes.
- Malaysia maintains a US$24.8 billion trade surplus with the US in 2024 and seeks new export markets through CPTPP and RCEP.

items.title: Pinduoduo to invest $13.7b to aid merchants
items.summary:
- Pinduoduo, a Chinese e-commerce platform, plans to invest 100 billion yuan ($13.7 billion) over the next three years.
- The investment is aimed at enhancing the transformation and upgrading of merchants on its platform.
- The announcement was made on April 3.

items.title: AirTrunk pursues $1.7b green loan for major Singapore data center
items.summary:
- AirTrunk is seeking a US$1.7 billion green loan for a new data center in Singapore.
- The data center will have an 80.2-megawatt capacity and will operate under long-term contracts until December 31, 2050.
- The project is being developed for a major US client, with AirTrunk expected to lease some power back.

items.title: Thailand’s richest man’s $21.4b company debuts on stock market
items.author: Sarath Ratanavadi
items.summary:
- Gulf Development debuted on the stock exchange on Apr. 3 after merging Gulf Energy Development and Intouch Holdings Pcl.
- The new entity had a market valuation of 736 billion baht (around US$21.4 billion), down 13% from the pre-merger value.
- The stock opened at 49.75 baht (around US$1.45) and rose 1% despite economic challenges including a 36% US tariff and a recent earthquake in Myanmar.
- The merger combines power, infrastructure, and LNG operations with telecom assets, including a major stake in Advanced Info Service, Thailand’s second-largest mobile operator.
- This merger is part of Ratanavadi's strategy to expand into high-growth sectors like AI and data centers.

items.title: MobiKwik stock drops 56% from peak following Q3 losses
US Dollar Weakens as Trump Announces New Tariffs
items.summary:
- The US dollar weakened on Apr. 3 after Trump announced new tariffs on imports effective Apr. 9.
- Tariffs include a 10% baseline levy and higher duties on goods from 60 countries, raising global economic slowdown concerns.
- Global stocks declined; demand for bonds and gold increased; the yen rose 1.3% to 147.39 per dollar.
- Asian currencies suffered, with China's yuan hitting its weakest levels; other currencies like the ringgit and won also declined.
- The dollar index fell to 102.98, its lowest since October, marking a 4% decline this year.

items.title: Green shoots in greentech logistics
D2C snacking brand Sweet Karam Coffee nets $8m series A
items.summary:
- Sweet Karam Coffee, a Chennai-based D2C snacking brand, has raised US$8 million in series A funding led by Peak XV Partners, with participation from Fireside Ventures.
- The funding will assist in expanding its product range and geographical reach.
- Founded in 2015, the company offers South Indian snacks, sweets, condiments, ghee, and filter coffee, selling across 32 countries via ecommerce and quick commerce channels.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Indonesia
items.summary:
- The article features a list of Indonesian startups on the rise based on recent funding rounds.
- It only includes companies that have reached up to series E stage.
- Each entry provides key details about their funding rounds.
- The information is generated using Tech in Asia data and is constantly updated.
- Additional resources are available, including a comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia and the research methodology used.

items.title: Australia dodges US tariffs, but faces economic risks
items.summary:
- Australia avoids steep reciprocal tariffs imposed by the US under Trump, facing only a general 10% tariff.
- Exempt from higher tariffs impacting countries like China, Japan, and South Korea.
- Australian beef farmers may face challenges due to new trade barriers; gold and pharmaceuticals are exempted.
- Prime Minister Anthony Albanese criticizes tariffs as unwarranted but notes Australia is better off than others.
- Foreign minister Penny Wong emphasizes impact on Asian economies and the need for calm amid disruptions.
- Analysts warn tariffs could slow construction and manufacturing in North Asia, affecting Australia’s economy.
- Economic slowdown in China, Australia’s top trading partner, poses risks to resource-heavy regions, especially Western Australia.
